intro: Phyteuma orbiculare crucis, commonly known as the Cross-leaved Phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive, cross-shaped leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and wildflower displays.
